sen.j: 松尾寺の仏舞（まつのおでらのほとけまい）は、京都府舞鶴市にある松尾寺 (舞鶴市)に伝わる宗教的儀式。
sen.e: The Matsuo-dera Temple hotokemai (Buddhist dance) is a religious ritual conducted at Matsuo no Dera Temple (Maizuru City) in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 仏舞は大日如来、釈迦如来、阿弥陀如来の三像の面を着け、越天楽の譜に合わせて優雅に舞うもので、奈良時代に唐から伝えられたものと言われる。
sen.e: Hotokemai is a dance performed wearing masks representing Dainichi Nyorai, Shaka Nyorai and Amida Nyorai to Etenraku music that is reputed to have been transmitted from Tang Dynasty China during the Nara period.

sen.j: 仏舞の由来や始まりは松尾寺の古い記録が焼失してしまったため不明だが、江戸時代初期には既に舞われていた記録は残っている。
sen.e: The origin and beginnings of the Hotokemai are unknown as Ancient Matsuo no Dera Temple records were lost to fire but records remain stating that the ritual was already being performed by the early Edo period.
